subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get

Thanks Jim! IMO, that is the biggest problem that serious researchers of an=
y field  face-their own biases. It is good to be skeptical, but you HAVE to=
 keep open to any possibility, and realize that there can be holes in even =
your own, well thought out theories. Once you think you know it all and don=
't need to test further, you are lost.

I have several pairs of headphones,=
 but my best pair are Sennheiser eH 150's. I don't truly know a whole lot a=
bout headphones, I only know these came highly recommended and were moderat=
ely priced. I think I paid $50. They are very light and comfortable for ful=
l headphones. They have thick, padded ear cuffs and a padded headband. The =
others I have-the ear bud types, make my ears hurt. On investigations I use=
 them for live monitoring, so I wear them for long periods of time.

I woul=
d be willing to try the Numark one's, if your willing to let me :)

Can I e=
mail my address to you privately?


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From:=
 James W. Hyslope 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, May 16,=
 2009 7:54 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get





 =
 April, you seem like such a nice person:) If I had your address I would SE=
ND you a pair of the Numark 125 headphones. Just because ypu do listen and =
are not "set" in your ways. Good luck always. Jim H--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > I am always happy to=
 listen, whether I can hear it or not. :)

---- 
  > From: James W. Hyslope

what you get

  > Yes April, I have the same belief=
 as you.....if EVP's are of the personal nature, no matter if they yell int=
o the microphone....if you are not the intended receiver you will NEVER hea=
r or understand it. I do know my EVP's are very LOW audio. I need to work w=
ith that and AMP them I guess. In some recordings (1927 is one of them) I c=
an't hear the voice sometimes, that is how low it is. But tonight I finishe=
d my comparison recorder evaluations (ran 3 recorders that night) my Sony I=
CD B7 also heard the date. The Panasonic RR-US360 could not hear it. I will=
 upload a GET-OUT evp that the RR-DR60 only heard too. Was recorded same ti=
me as the asking of date.As for "what kind of ears I have" :) I do have pre=
tty good hearing (but have some loss in certain areas) maybe my losses are =
closer to the static's level and I am helped there....I don't know yet. I h=
ave seen enough people (half) that I personally let hear these....they can'=
t hear them either (some of them) so I understand why others can't hear the=
m. Just to "loop" (continual repeat) of only the evp is helpful sometimes. =
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@" <Threadsintyme@> wrote:
  =
> >
  > > It might just make a difference if we knew what shape dem ears of=
 yurns' are! LOL

  > > LOL! ----- Origina=
l Message ----- From: Frank Sumption To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com Sent: Frid=
ay, May 15, 2009 2:14 PMSubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what yo=
u get
  > > I always listen to EVP wiht my ears!--I know--alien humor.
  > =
> 
  > > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 1:24 PM, April Abercrombie <april@> wrote:=

  > > 
  > > 
  > > I always listen to EVP's with high quality headphones.=
 In the "tomorrow let you know" EVP, I do hear something....just can't be s=
ure that it is a voice. I does have a cadence similar to someone speaking, =
but it could just as easily be something present in the environment-a natur=
al background noise. There is no way for me to tell for certain as it is ju=
st too feint. I can't make out any clear words. Sure-I could probably matri=
x some in, but that is all it would be. For an EVP to be considered proof p=
ositive of spirit communication by the community at large, it has to be cle=
ar enough that many people hear the same thing, without hints or coaxing. I=
f you have to have high quality devices to make it out, it just isn't good =
enough. That does not mean it isn't a true EVP, just that it isn't good eno=
ugh to stand as evidence. As for the whistle, it sounded like feedback to m=
e as well, but I will have to take you word for it that you were no where n=
ear any other electronics or EMF's that could contribute to feedback. Even =
so, if I am trying to remain unbiased and objective, there is no way for me=
 to say this is a spirit, without personally being with you when you caught=
 it. The only thing I can still say about it is could be, but for me it is =
non conclusive. If someone does not hear what you are hearing, try to remai=
n objective and just understand that it isn't personal. You have to underst=
and that with just these recordings alone, there is no way to scientificall=
y prove what you have recorded is spirit communication. If you could get co=
nsistent, intelligent question and answer recordings, then you would be alo=
t closer. Here again, we are back to the "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE t=
o prove anything scientifically, unless you want others to completely belie=
ve in your evidence. The theory that is being kicked around is that some EV=
P's are personal, and only meant for the person recording them to hear. If =
this is the case, no matter how clear something is to you, others may not h=
ear it. April ----- Original Message ----- From: James W. Hyslope To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 12:02 PMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re=
: what you hear is what you get
  > > Okay, I can respect that. If you can'=
t hear them then it must be either mechanical (sound card or headphones)or =
maybe your hearing has loss in those frequencies....Some of these are not v=
ery clear or loud enough too. But many will depend on your computer sound c=
ard & your headphones. I have let an older man listen (in his late 60's) an=
d he has heard most all of the audio. Same with a few guys at work. Some he=
ar them right away, and others can't until I loop the actually EVP for a fe=
w tries. I personally use a Dell Latitude D430 to hear these. I can hear so=
me on my cell phone. Headphones are a must....or you won't hear anything ei=
ther way. *But some can be heard on cell phone without headphones. The conv=
ersion to MP3 has also caused some loss, but I am still able to hear them w=
hen I review from this site (but I have the repetive hearing syndrome in th=
is area no doubt). Although I do have some disbelief (shock) that a few of =
these are not discernable. Go back and listen to "tomorrow let you know" is=
 in a gruffy-robotic melodic tone at the very end but with higher natural v=
olume. And if you couldn't hear the whistle...I would suggest the need to r=
emove the cotton from the ear :) As for feedback.....feedback from what? I =
only had one recorder working here. I would rather hear someone say "I" mad=
e the whistle....that would be more understandable. And is very true....if =
someone "tells" the group that THIS is supposed to be what WAS said, then i=
s very difficult to clear the mind to hear it any other way. Kinda like try=
ing to hum another song while a different one is playing :) --- In EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:
  > > >
  > > > Here's=
 the thing though - if you put something out there, and ask people to liste=
n to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and some won't,=
 no matter what.
  > > > 
  > > > If EVP messages are for the one that reco=
rded them, then it shouldn't surprise you, or offend you, if someone doesn'=
t hear the same thing you do. If you don't want contrary opinions on someth=
ing, then you should not give people the chance to critique.
  > > > 
  > >=
 > Now I could see if someone flat out said your recordings were all trash,=
 period. You would have every right to be angry, but no one is saying that,=
 at least I am not saying that.
  > > > 
  > > > I just stated that I did n=
ot hear what James heard, and though I wasn't going to say he doesn't have =
anything, I can't say that he does either.

Message -----

  > > > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com

ons.

 10:53 AM, April Abercrombie <april@> wrote:

one that recorded thmm, to everyone else it's non-sense, except there's eno=

d of these self proclaimed experts trying to dicate what's acceptable.

 opened your folder and examined all your files.

my opinions (I have truncated the file names due to laziness):

l_us (enhanced) several listenings: pixelated, no speech

nasonic noises, no speech
  > > > compare_sony noises, no speech
  > > > fi=
rst_epv noises, no speech

dback)

  > > > hey_whats noises, no speec=
h

  > > > important_date noises, no speech

evp noises, no speech

ch

  > > > miss_you noises, no speech
 =

  > > > oh_ noises, no spe=
ech

ns noises, no speech
  > > > that's_jim noises, no speech

several listenings: noises, no speech

  =
> > > 
  > > > The ones that took several listenings I thought I might hear=
 words in, so I examined those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hea=
r something that sort of sounded like what you suggested, but I could also =
hear it in other ways, or not at all.
  > > > 
  > > > So my suggestion to =
you, if you want to get less subjective conjuctures or simply less affirmat=
ions of your own interpretations, is to post the future ones without labels=
. The labels you give can influence the listeners: when you have a sound th=
at could be several things, and you note that it sounded like "keep it movi=
ng", the listener can find it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what you=
 heard, and so not be able to give a fresh perspecive to help your research=
 methods. 
  > > > 
  > > > 
  > > > 
  > > > --- In EVP-ITC@...=
m, "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@> wrote:
  > > > >
  > > > > Go to my Fol=
der in the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to)=
 decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of the serious type. In my short t=
ime I have gathered enough "proof" for myself that this method works for ME=
. And from what I have seen from others that I have let "listen" to my file=
s (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" to HEAR very low audio artifact=
s....so this will help me in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reac=
h my goals (or help others) with their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER=
 NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....=
it missed a few evp's real close together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD=
-B7 heard a male use a different number than what I used. I said 16 (my ear=
lier age I was saying in recorder) and the male evp said 13....then a femal=
e laughs. All this was missed by the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in bot=
h recorders) BUT then the DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of=
 the 5 second clip....the DR60 heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) males =
voice. So this is very promising piece of evidence for me. **those 2 record=
ings have been uploaded to my folder. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon =
as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to=
 go with my RR-QR100, and one more (can't remember what brand-model of this=
 last---due to arrive) LOL. I need to build a multiple mounting devise to a=
id in putting these into tandem service. Then I think I will use my Olympus=
 DS-50 as my "Control" recorder....by using it on the HQ settings. I am loo=
king to build a "subsonic" microphone also (something to do with those low =
"booms" that I have noticed lead or follow many evp's). So I look forward t=
o any ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
